alert.note: Alert for Knott; Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Knott and Letcher. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 859 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain fell due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bath, Sackett, Colson, Isom, Tillie, Amelia, Pine Top, Polly, Spider, May, Nealy, Redfox, Omaha, Lester and Littcarr. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
